senses.de: Possible, but not yet real or actual
senses.ex: He is a potential candidate for the job

Tips.title: Context Matters
Tips.description: Use 'potential' to suggest that something could happen or someone could be suitable for something in the future.
Tips.example: He has potential value for our team.

Tips.title: Pending Reality
Tips.description: 'Potential' implies something isn't yet real, but it could realistically happen or exist soon.
Tips.example: That empty lot has potential to become a community garden.

Tips.title: Hidden Possibilities
Tips.description: Use 'potential' when suggesting that not everyone can see the possible future value or outcome.
Tips.example: The artist sees potential in the rough sketch.

senses.de: The chance or possibility that something will happen in the future
senses.ex: There's a lot of potential for expansion in this company

Tips.title: Future Success
Tips.description: 'Potential' describes the promise that something good, successful, or beneficial might happen.
Tips.example: With hard work, your potential is limitless.

Tips.title: Unfulfilled Yet
Tips.description: Something with 'potential' hasn't achieved its success or best state, but it could.
Tips.example: Her unfinished novel holds great potential.

senses.de: The inherent ability or capacity for growth, development, or coming into being
senses.ex: She has the potential to become a great musician

Tips.title: Growing Talent
Tips.description: Use 'potential' to talk about someone's capabilities that may develop further.
Tips.example: The young athlete has incredible potential.

Tips.title: Not Yet Realized
Tips.description: When a skill or quality isn't fully developed, refer to it as 'potential'.
Tips.example: The teacher noticed his potential in math.

senses.de: In physics, it's the stored energy in a body or system due to its position in a force field or due to its configuration
senses.ex: The gravitational potential of a planet

Tips.title: Technical Term
Tips.description: In physics, 'potential' is a specific term that refers to stored energy, not to be used casually.

Tips.title: Invisible Energy
Tips.description: Potential energy is invisible but it explains how objects can move or react in the future.
Tips.example: Water behind a dam has potential to generate electricity.

Aptitude.wordDefinition:
Aptitude refers to a person's natural ability or talent for a particular skill or subject. It's like having a knack for something without necessarily having put in any effort to learn it.

Aptitude is applicable when considering a person's inherent abilities or strengths in a particular area, such as a musical aptitude or a mathematical aptitude.

Capability.wordDefinition:
Capability refers to a person's existing skills and abilities that they can use right now. Potential refers to what someone is capable of achieving with effort or training.

For example, if someone has a capability for playing the piano, it means they are already good at playing it currently.

Capability is applicable when you want to know what a person can do based on their current skills and abilities. Potential is applicable when you want to know what a person might be able to do with some training or effort.

Capacity.wordDefinition:
Capacity and potential are often used interchangeably, but they actually have different meanings.

Capacity refers to the maximum amount that something can hold or do. A glass has a capacity of 8 ounces, meaning it can hold up to 8 ounces of liquid.

A person's capacity to lift weights might be 50 pounds, meaning they can lift up to 50 pounds without causing injury to themselves.

To summarize, capacity is about what something or someone can do right now, while potential is about what they can become in the future.

Capacity is measurable, while potential is a possibility.

Likelihood.wordDefinition:
Likelihood refers to the chance that something may happen based on past experiences or evidence. For example, there is a high likelihood that it may rain because the sky is cloudy and the air feels damp.

Likelihood is based on evidence and past experiences, while potential is based on possible future outcomes.

Possibility.wordDefinition:
Possibility refers to something that could happen or be true, but there may be other factors involved that could prevent it from happening.

For example, if someone says "there is a possibility that it will rain tomorrow," it means that they are not certain whether or not it will rain.

Possibility highlights uncertainty, while potential highlights ability.

Potentiality.wordDefinition:
Potentiality refers to the inherent or theoretical possibility of something. For example, the potentiality of the internet to connect people around the world is vast.

In simpler terms, potential refers to what someone or something can become, while potentiality is a more abstract concept that refers to the possibility of something happening.

Promise.wordDefinition:
Promise means to give someone confidence that something will happen or be a certain way in the future.

For example, a company may promise to deliver a product to a customer by a certain date, and the customer trusts that the company will fulfill its promise.

Potential is about what can be developed or accomplished in the future, while promise is about what will be accomplished or delivered in the future.

Prospect.wordDefinition:
Prospect refers more specifically to a likelihood or chance of something happening, often based on external factors or circumstances.

For example, a job prospect refers to the chance of getting a particular job based on factors like qualifications and experience, as well as the employer's needs and preferences.

Both words can describe future possibilities, but potential is more focused on internal qualities or abilities, while prospect is more focused on external factors or circumstances.

quotes.Text: God puts people in our lives on purpose so we can help them succeed and help them become all He created them to be. Most people will not reach their full potential without somebody else believing in them.
quotes.Title: American Clergyman
quotes.Name: Joel Osteen

quotes.Text: But I think there are a set of experiences that turn a potential writer into a working writer, and then there are places in your life were you start to recognize what you want to do.
quotes.Title: Author
quotes.Name: Stephen King

quotes.Text: There is so much potential out there in young people and they aren't getting the right information or being encouraged in the right ways. This is our duty as a society.
quotes.Title: American Scientist
quotes.Name: Ben Carson

quotes.Text: God, our Creator, has stored within our minds and personalities, great potential strength and ability. Prayer helps us tap and develop these powers.
quotes.Title: Indian Statesman
quotes.Name: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam

quotes.Text: I think my grandmother saw my potential first. When I was young, I told her, 'I think I should get a job.' She said, 'No, just keep boxing.
quotes.Title: American Boxer
quotes.Name: Floyd Mayweather, Jr.

quotes.Text: Everybody has a creative potential and from the moment you can express this creative potential, you can start changing the world.
quotes.Title: Brazilian Novelist
quotes.Name: Paulo Coelho

quotes.Text: It's when we become afraid of everything and worried about everything that you are never going to reach your highest potential.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Alicia Keys

quotes.Text: Free the child's potential, and you will transform him into the world.
quotes.Title: Italian Educator
quotes.Name: Maria Montessori

quotes.Text: I love inspiring people and helping them to reach their potential.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Richard Hatch

quotes.Text: Humanity has only scratched the surface of its real potential.
quotes.Title: American Activist
quotes.Name: Peace Pilgrim
